thread.title: Burt Bacharach plays along at 'Close to You' launch
thread.title_full: Burt Bacharach plays along at 'Close to You' launch

title: Burt Bacharach plays along at 'Close to You' launch
text:
Burt Bacharach plays along at 'Close to You' launch 9:35pm EDT - 01:33 
'Close to You', the theatrical adaptation of classic songwriter Burt Bacharach's music, opens in London with a singalong with the cast and the veteran musician. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)   
ROUGH CUT (NO REPORTER NARRATION) Legendary music composer Burt Bacharach led a public sing-along at the West End opening night of 'Close To You' theatre show in London on Thursday (Oct. 15). The show features 30 of his greatest hits including 'Anyone Who Had A Heart' and 'What The World Needs Now'. Speaking after the show Bacharach summed up the night saying, "It's a great honour to have my music done like this and received like this. Very emotional. It's a very good night for me." Bacharach is a six-time Grammy Award and three-time Academy Award winner. 'Close To You: Bacharach Reimagined', the musical will play a strictly limited season from October 3, 2015 to January 10, 2016.  //reut.rs/1ZH8qLD
